before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsif8","text":"We are happy to share HIV-1 samples for public health lab validations if we have materials available. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"avtuj","text":"The Florida Department of Health's Bureau of Public Health Laboratories in Jacksonville has developed a protocol for the Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) of HIV, primarily for the purpose of drug-resistant mutation identification. This HIV-1 protocol uses amplicon-based sequencing based on primers designed by the BEEHIVE Consortium (https://www.beehive.ox.ac.uk/). The amplified pol gene regions can be used in both genotyping and drug resistance determination.   Our protocol utilizes newer enzymes with higher fidelity for sequencing and Illumina sequencing technology.  We have cross verified 3 different Illumina Sequencing platforms to ensure that all produce equivalent results so that in the event of a surge samples can be sequenced quickly and in mixed-species pools. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":335,"length":29}],"data":{}},{"key":"em5et","text":"The NGS data generated can also be used in surveillance and outbreak monitoring, giving epidemiologist more information about circulating viral genomes.  There is also the potential that this protocol can be expanded to whole genome sequencing for HIV-1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5s9ub","text":"The imminent sunsetting of ViroSeq (Abbott Molecular) has required many labs to look for new methods to continue identifying HIV-1 drug resistance strains for both clinical management and epidemiological study. NGS was chosen as it is more cost effective than investing in a single pathogen platform. NGS allows for one sample to produce results and data that can aid not just a patient but an entire population. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"197BF4F3B74811EC942B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.beehive.ox.ac.uk"}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5CFF52B2B74811EC94400A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5CFF5246B74811EC94400A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

Please consult with your CLIA director to establish an appropriate study to develop your own HIV-1 sequencing test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: This protocol is intended to provide  instructions for a public health/clinical laboratory technologist to develope and preform a HIV-1 Drug-Resistance Sequencing Laboratory Developed Test.  This assay is designed to sequence the pol gene of Human Immunodeficiency Virus, type 1 (HIV-1) and detect mutations associated with resistance as well as providing a genotype for surveillance purposes.

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nahi","text":"We currently use SmartGene HIV-1 pipeline (https://www.smartgene.com/) for analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":26}],"data":{}},{"key":"5sn3o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1lpe","text":"Pipeline Name: HIV-1 PR+RT+IN ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ht75","text":"Version 2.4.5_HIV1_v1.6","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56qvq","text":"Noise Filter [%] 0.5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6thng","text":"Interpretation cut off [%] 5.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9m4rf","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1omqb","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d130k","text":"Minimum read depth and additional criteria should be determined by your institution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DF42D78B74A11EC94970A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.smartgene.com"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1mimt","text":"Gall A, Ferns B, Morris C, Watson S, Cotten M, Robinson M, Berry N, Pillay D, Kellan P. Universal Amplification, Next-Generation Sequencing, and Assembly of HIV-1 Genomes. Journal of Clinical Microbiology. 2012; 50:12. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9uvv","text":"doi: 10.1128/JCM.01516-12","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a45t4","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6an1e","text":"Cornelissen M, Gall A, Vink M, Zorkrager F, Binter S, Edwards S, Jurriaans S, Bakker M, Ong SH, Gras L, van Sighem A, Bexemer D, de Wolf F, Reiss P, Kellam P, Berkhout B, Fraser C, van der Kuyl AC, the BEEHIVE Consortium. From clinical samples to complete genome: Comparing methods for the extraction of HIV-1 RNA for high-throughput deep sequencing. Virus Research. 2017; 239:10-16. doi: 10.1016/j.virusres.2016.08.004","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":389,"length":30}],"data":{}},{"key":"epn71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dti4g","text":"Previous Protocols","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"558hs","text":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.btrnnm5e","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":49}],"data":{}},{"key":"62re0","text":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.btpqnmmw","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":49}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C1D75ADDB74A11EC94970A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.virusres.2016.08.004"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CC258D6FB74A11EC94970A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.btrnnm5e"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FB5D21CFB74A11EC949C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.btpqnmmw"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fuaoc","text":"We have successfully sequenced these libraries on the following platforms:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5abk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ks3s","text":"iSeq","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl2ef","text":"MiSeq","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fi3v","text":"NextSeq","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a688u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cep2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bf8a","text":"The MiSeq and NextSeq are usually mixed organism pools.  This has had no discernable adverse effect on HIV-1 Drug-Resistance Sequencing results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
